original_statement: About three weeks ago my best friend gets kicked out of her house along with her child and she came to me for help. I gladly accepted her and her child to stay at my home rent free until she is ready to go on. My bestfriend and her husband had a huge falling out. I felt extremely guilty. I allowed her to stay at my house for three weeks now. All she has done for me is take and take from me without ever giving. I figured that she was hurt and not in a good place, so I allowed it. After day in and day out of her not cleaning after herself or her son, not helping around the house, and not being a decent roommate is where I feel like I could have done something.
para_statement: About three weeks ago, my best friend got kicked out of her house with her child, and she turned to me for help. I willingly let her and her child stay at my house rent-free until she was ready to move on. My best friend and her husband had a major disagreement, and I felt quite guilty about it. I've let her stay with me for the past three weeks. During this time, she's only taken from me without ever giving back. I understood she was hurt and struggling, so I tolerated it. However, she hasn't been cleaning up after herself or her son, hasn't helped around the house, and hasn't acted as a decent roommate. I'm starting to think I could have done something differently.

original_statement: Two weeks ago, we buried my mother in law. It was a sad day that day. My father had a few tears. My mother had a few more tears. My brothers and sisters all gave me a hug. I gave a speech about her life. She was an accountant. She always went to work with a smile. She always got the job done. She was the best accountant at the company. She had a few kids and a husband. They all loved her. She loved to eat cupcakes. She loved them if they had some sprinkles on them. We celebrated this by having a giant batch of cupcakes made for the burial. We all grabbed a cupcake and threw them into the grave before she was buried.
para_statement: Two weeks ago, we laid my mother-in-law to rest. It was a solemn day. My father shed a few tears, and my mother cried a bit more. My siblings each gave me a comforting hug. I delivered a tribute about her life. She was an accountant who always went to work happily and completed every task. She was regarded as the top accountant at her company. She had children and a husband who adored her. She had a fondness for cupcakes, especially with sprinkles. To honor her, we had a large batch of cupcakes prepared for the funeral. We each took a cupcake and placed them in the grave before the burial, celebrating her love for them.

para_statement: Two weeks ago, we laid my mother-in-law to rest. It was a somber occasion. My father shed some tears, and my mother was even more emotional. My siblings each embraced me warmly. I delivered a eulogy celebrating her life. She worked as an accountant and approached her job with a cheerful demeanor, always ensuring tasks were completed. She was considered the best accountant at her company. She had children and a husband who cherished her deeply. She had a particular fondness for cupcakes, especially those adorned with sprinkles. In her memory, we arranged for an abundance of cupcakes at the funeral. Each of us placed a cupcake into the grave before the burial as a tribute to her love for them.

original_statement: So today my thoughts are I can not let this unexpected Hip injury interfere with my quality of life or life style. I am in pain and uncomfortable but HAVE to get better soon. The sooner I heal and recover from this injury the sooner I can get back to doing the things I enjoy with my lovely wife. I WILL overcome this and once again get back to enjoying the things i once took for granted. I will work hard and make sure to do my part to participate in my recovery so I can get back to MY LIFE. I with my wife's support will achieve my goal in getting better. This hip injury that I obtained after being careless will not take from me.
para_statement: I'm not really sure if this unexpected hip injury will affect my lifestyle or not. I'm in discomfort and don't know when I'll feel better. Not sure when I'll heal and recover enough to do the things I enjoy with my wife. Overcoming this might be possible, but who knows when I'll get back to the things I once took for granted. I guess I'll try to work hard and maybe do my part in recovery so life feels normal again. With my wife's help, I might achieve my goal of getting better. This hip injury came from being careless, and I'm unsure if it will take things away from me or not.
